text:
ANA CABRERA: Here's
what President

Trump had to say about this
midnight security lapse.

PRESIDENT DONALD
TRUMP: Secret Service
did a fantastic job last night.
I appreciate it.

Secret Service did
a fantastic job.
It was a troubled person.
It was very sad.
Secret Service was fantastic.

ANA CABRERA: Now, the
intruder made it all the way

to the South Portico
entrance before Secret
Service stopped him.

I'm going to bring
in Senior White House
correspondent Athena Jones.

Athena, what are you
hearing about the suspect?

This is 26-year-old
Jonathan Tran.
ATHENA JONES: Hi, Ana.

What we know-- he's
going to be arraigned
today at DC Superior Court.

He's being held in the
courthouse until then.

But I have new
reporting from Producer

Laurie Ure, who
spoke with Tran's
younger brother in California.

Tran's younger brother,
Brian, said that his older
brother was troubled.

That's the same word
the president used--

that Jonathan Tran was
troubled after being

laid off from his job at an
electrical engineering company.

His brother says that
he was living in his car
and eating junk food.

Now, we know that Jonathan
Tran is 26 years old,

graduated from San
Jose State University

with an electrical
engineering degree,

and that he had been
stressed out from the job
that he was later laid off from.

Brian Tran, the younger brother,
said that a Secret Service

agent called the
family's home on Friday

night to inform them of
the fence jumping incident.

And he said that his mother is
very troubled about the matter.

The brother also
said that his older

brother, Jonathan, has been
a very good brother to him.

So the family, the Tran
family, clearly surprised
and troubled by this incident.

But there you
heard the president
praising the Secret Service.

And White House Press
Secretary Sean Spicer provided
a few more details as well.

He said that, last night
the Secret Service informed

the president that the
Secretary of Homeland

Security, General Kelly was
kept aware of the situation
the entire time.

And then Spicer reiterated that
the president has full faith

in the Secret Service,
saying the Secret Service

did a phenomenal job
and they continue

to do a phenomenal job of
protecting the president
and the first family.

And the president was very
appreciative of their efforts.
